title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate real GDP per capita for Hatherville for Year 2 as $100, does not calculate real GDP per capita for Planington for Year 2 as $100, and/or does not show the work.

The response calculates real GDP per capita for Hatherville for Year 2 as $100, calculates real GDP per capita for Planington for Year 2 as $100, and shows the work.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Hatherville has the higher money supply in Year 2 and/or does not explain that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvaiaab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D14@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Hatherville has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Hatherville has the higher money supply.

The response states that Hatherville has the higher money supply in Year 2 and explains that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvaiaab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D14@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Hatherville has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Hatherville has the higher money supply.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Planington experienced the higher real interest rate and/or does not explain that Planington had lower inflation (deflation) and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate or explain that the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate plus the deflation rate.

The response states that Planington experienced the higher real interest rate and explains that Planington had lower inflation (deflation) and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate or explain that the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate plus the deflation rate.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the demand for money and the nominal interest rate will decrease and/or does not explain that the decrease in the GDP deflator from Year 1 to Year 2 in Planington indicates a decrease in the price level, which will decrease the demand for money and therefore decrease the nominal interest rate.

The response states that the demand for money and the nominal interest rate will decrease and explains that the decrease in the GDP deflator from Year 1 to Year 2 in Planington indicates a decrease in the price level, which will decrease the demand for money and therefore decrease the nominal interest rate.
